children.text: Catherine Fraser is a clean air associate with Environment Texas.

node.title: What is ozone?

children.text: Houston has never met federal health-based standards for ozone, set by the Environmental Protection Agency.

mainImage.caption: When it comes to climate action and disaster recovery, equity means getting resources to communities that have been traditionally underserved, Alcorn says. Courtesy photo.

node.title: 'How can we do better?': A conversation with Houston City Council Member Sallie Alcorn

children.text: For Houston to be more equitable, resources have to get to parts of the city that have been traditionally underserved.

children.text: Houston lies at the epicenter of combined risks from climate change, industrial pollution, environmental injustice and urban sprawl.

node.title: ‘We can't solve climate change without state legislators’: A conversation with Climate Cabinet Action's Caroline Spears

children.text: It’s time for lawmakers to listen to the 81 percent of Texans who believe climate change is happening and invest in the clean energy jobs we need.
